Class BattleshipWorld

  • java.lang.Object
    • gridworld.world.World<Actor>
      • gridworld.actor.ActorWorld
        • BattleshipWorld

  • public class BattleshipWorld
extends ActorWorld
    A class to extend ActorWorld to work with the Battleship game.
    Version:
    06/16/2017
    Author:
    Phillip Sturtevant

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      BattleshipWorld(Grid<Actor> grid)
      Constructs a battleship world with a given grid.

      • getGridClicked

        public boolean getGridClicked()
        Gets if the grid was clicked in the Player's turn
        Returns:
        true if the grid was clicked, false if the grid was not clicked

      • getHitShip

        public boolean getHitShip()
        Gets whether Computer has hit a Battleship
        Returns:
        true if the Computer hit the Battleship, false if the Computer did not hit the Battleship

        pressInput - true if space bar is pressed, false if space bar is not pressed

      • setGameStart

        public void setGameStart(boolean start)
        Sets whether it is the Player's turn and they can click squares
        Parameters:
        start - true if it is the Player's turn, false if it is not the Player's turn

        public void setHitShip(boolean hitShip)
        Sets whether Computer hit the Battleship

        public void setClickLocation(Location compClick)
        Stores the click location of the Computer
        Parameters:
        compClick - click location of the Computer

      • locationClicked

        public boolean locationClicked(Location loc)
        Overrides original method. Checks if Player/Computer clicked a grid location. If so and it was their turn, sets their ability to click to false.
        Overrides:
        locationClicked in class World<Actor>
        Parameters:
        loc - Location in the grid that was clicked.
        Returns:
        true if the Player clicked the grid on their turn, false if the Player clicked the grid, but it was not their turn

      • shipPlacer

        public void shipPlacer(java.util.ArrayList<Battleship> currentShips,
                       java.util.ArrayList<Location> shipLocations,
                       Battleship ship,
                       int playerNum)
        Takes the keyboard as input to move Battleships to their desired location.
        Parameters:
        currentShips - the list of the Player's Battleships
        shipLocations - the list of the Player's Battleship part locations
        ship - the Battleship to be placed
        playerNum - the identifying number for the Player/Computer

      • hitCheck

        public boolean hitCheck(java.util.ArrayList<Battleship> playerShip,
                        Computer compPlayer,
                        int playerNum)
        Checks if the Player click location hit or missed the opponent's Battleships.
        Parameters:
        playerShip - a list of the opponent's Battleships
        compPlayer - the Computer Player
        playerNum - the identifying number of the Player/Computer
        Returns:
        true if the Player hit the Battleship, false if the Player missed the Battleship

      • shipStatus

        public void shipStatus(java.util.ArrayList<Battleship> shipList,
                       Computer compPlayer,
                       int playerNum)
        Checks the status of all Battleships to see if they are alive.
        Parameters:
        shipList - a list of the opponent's Battleships
        compPlayer - the Computer Player
        playerNum - the identifying number for the Player/Computer

      • shipSpawner

        public void shipSpawner(java.util.ArrayList<Battleship> playerShips,
                        java.util.ArrayList<Location> shipLocations,
                        int shipQuantity,
                        int playerNum)
        Spawns the Battleships to be set-up in the Battleship world and saves their location when placed.
        Parameters:
        playerShips - the list of the Player's Battleships
        shipLocations - the list of all the Player's Battleship part locations
        shipQuantity - the number of Battleships that are in the current game
        playerNum - the identifying number for the Player/Computer

      • pauseProgram

        public void pauseProgram(int sleepTimer)
        Pauses the game.
        Parameters:
        sleepTimer - The length of time the program will pause (in milliseconds)
